entry.title: SBF Can't Blame FTX Attorneys At the Start Of His Trial, Says Judge
entry.summary: The defense can't say "his lawyers made him do it" in its opening statement, but the “advice of counsel” argument can be made later.

entry.title: For Mark Zuckerberg, Advances in AI Still Lead Back to the Metaverse
entry.summary: Meta’s ambitions of taking the lead in augmented reality development has not ebbed away, and CEO Mark Zuckerberg sees artificial intelligence as a way to make that happen.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Binance’s CZ and the SEC’s Gary Gensler Face Stiff Criticism
entry.summary: Meanwhile, Justin Sun offered a job and $400,000 to the hacker that purloined $8 million from HTX.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Has Few Pathways to Acquittal, Say Legal Experts
entry.summary: The former crypto mogul has limited defense strategies, and some could backfire.

entry.title: SBF Trial Prosecution Previews the Witnesses It Plans to Call
entry.summary: The government alerted the court that it will present testimony from FTX customers, investors, and unnamed co-conspirators to make their case against Sam Bankman-Fried.

entry.title: Ethereum Supply Is Starting to Grow Again as Gas Prices Plummet
entry.summary: The network is deflationary over shorter time frames, but inflationary on longer ones. What gives?

entry.title: In Emerging Economies Like Chile, Worldcoin Is Seeing Strong Success
entry.summary: Having your eyeballs scanned earns you about $42—not an insignificant sum in some countries.

entry.title: Paris-Based Mistral AI Enters the Arena with Free and Powerful New Language Model
entry.summary: The new LLM is free, open-source, and stands up well against more established competitors.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: ETF Hype Pumps Ethereum and Bitcoin as Chainlink and Bitcoin Cash Surge
entry.summary: Even though prices have mostly felt static this year, markets have come a long way since New Year.

entry.title: Naomi Campbell Debuts Humane AI Pin at Coperni's Paris Fashion Week Show
entry.summary: Humane's wearable AI device will be revealed in November, but it made a public appearance on the supermodel elite via the Coperni runway.

entry.title: OpenAI Quietly Ships DALL-E 3 AI Image Generator Upgrade In Bing
entry.summary: The next-generation AI art tool is described as a leap ahead of competitors Midjourney and Stable Diffusion.

entry.title: Inside Art Blocks' Marfa Weekend, Digital Art's Latest Hotspot
entry.summary: Hundreds of artists, patrons, and fellow travelers flocked to the West Texas desert last weekend to take part in the annual generative art festival, which shows no signs of slowing its ballooning expansion.

entry.title: Biggest Video Games Releasing in October 2023
entry.summary: From Assassin's Creed Mirage to Spider-Man 2 and Super Mario Bros. Wonder, these are the can't-miss video game launches in October.

entry.title: Rising Rates Gives New Life to Interest-Bearing Stablecoins
entry.summary: Rising interest rates ain't all bad, as many decentralized stablecoin issuers are turning to real-world assets to generate new yield.

entry.title: Stablecoin Legislation Looms Despite Threat of Government Shutdown
entry.summary: “Things are complicated right now,” Congressman Patrick McHenry told Circle’s Chief Strategy Officer and Head of Global Policy.

entry.title: Galaxy and Invesco Join Growing Ethereum ETF Race
entry.summary: Galaxy and Invesco added their names to the Ethereum spot ETF field on Friday, even as worry of a government shutdown and SEC delays loom.

entry.title: Quantum Leap: Researchers Achieve Major Milestone for Reliable Quantum Computers
entry.summary: Researchers discovered a way to bring the industry closer to more reliable, powerful quantum computers less prone to errors or inaccuracies.

entry.title: What's Stopping Fortnite and Call of Duty From Using the Same Items? It's Not Just NFTs
entry.summary: Will the video game industry open up and play nice? These are the hurdles left to overcome to enable interoperable items at scale.

entry.title: Terra's Do Kwon Admits to Faking Trading Volume in Leaked Chat: Court Docs
entry.summary: "I won't tell if you won't," Terra's Do Kwon said, according to SEC documents.

entry.title: 'There Are No Real Standards': Ready Player Me CEO Timmu Tõke on Building for an Open Gaming Ecosystem
entry.summary: Timmu Tõke, co-founder and CEO of Ready Player Me, joins Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin to discuss the startup's approach to powering avatars that are interoperable across games and metaverse platforms—and what's needed to convince the industry to adopt standards and open up.

entry.title: Stablecoins Aren't Securities, Says Circle in SEC Lawsuits Against Binance
entry.summary: Neither BUSD nor USDC is a security, Circle argued—but was careful to say it's not picking sides in the case.

entry.title: Amazon Is Giving Away Free Gaming NFTs—Here's How to Claim
entry.summary: UPDATE: A new Mojo Melee champion NFT is now available for Amazon Prime subscribers, along with non-NFT items in Web3 game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Three Arrows Capital Co-Founder Su Zhu Arrested in Singapore
entry.summary: Su Zhu will serve a four-month sentence behind bars for not complying with court orders during 3AC's bankruptcy process.

entry.title: How On-Chain Attestations Unlock Blockchain’s Most Valuable Use Cases
entry.summary: KYC alone won’t cut it—to open up real world use cases for crypto, on-chain attestations are the solution for identity verification.

entry.title: $3 Billion in Bitcoin Options Expire Today—What Will That Do to BTC's Price?
entry.summary: Analysts say there's no sign that the expiring options will cause big swings in BTC's price.

entry.title: How Sam Bankman-Fried Ended Up in Jail
entry.summary: Super Bowl streaming with a VPN and witness tampering concerns eventually led Sam Bankman-Fried back to jail.

entry.title: Get Paid to Train AI? There’s a New Cryptocurrency for That
entry.summary: Ta-Da will soon offer a native token for data contributions, introducing a new model for training artificial intelligence.

entry.title: OpenTrade Launches Tokenized Treasury Bills on Protocol Developed by Circle
entry.summary: For every tokenized t-bill an investor purchases, OpenTrade will be buy an actual treasury bill and provide an on-chain identifier it.

entry.title: Crypto Market Flips Green Amid Ethereum Futures ETF Approval, Dollar Weakness
entry.summary: With October around the corner, Bitcoin and Ethereum appear to be returning to better form.

entry.title: Ann Hirsch's 'Sacra Famiglia' Puts a Surreal AI Spin on Suburbia
entry.summary: Artist Ann Hirsch's new web-browsing haunt "Sacra Famiglia" twists up family photos with the bizarre flourishes of generative AI.

entry.title: Cosmos Product Lead Says Ethereum Layer-2s Are Not the ‘Holy Grail’ of Scaling
entry.summary: Layer-2 networks are all the rage at the moment, but with user funds splintering across networks, the tech comes with its downsides.

entry.title: French Authorities Raid NVIDIA Offices Over Suspicions of Anti-Competitive Practices: Report
entry.summary: French authorities have raided NVIDIA's offices in Paris and Nice as part of a wider probe into the firm's competitive practices.

entry.title: Real-World Passions Will Onboard the Next Wave of Crypto Adopters
entry.summary: IRL experiences are key to on-chain identity and onboarding new users to the Web3 space, says MintPass founder Sam Simmons.

entry.title: SEC Delays Decision on Four Spot Bitcoin ETF Filings Ahead of Government Shutdown
entry.summary: The SEC's latest move is the second round of delays on the various spot Bitcoin ETF applications filed this year.

entry.title: Musée d’Orsay Embraces NFTs in Push to Reach New Audiences
entry.summary: The French art museum announced a partnership with the Tezos Foundation that will bring its collections into conversation with on-chain digital artists and blockchain-backed experiences.

entry.title: Republican FCC Commissioner Calls Renewed Net Neutrality Push 'Unlawful'
entry.summary: Digital rights group the Electronic Frontier Foundation praised the FCC’s move, emphasizing fair treatment of all data and warning against ISPs becoming gatekeepers.

entry.title: Xbox Chat Was Used to Share Insider Trading Secrets, Says SEC
entry.summary: The U.S. regulator alleged that participants of an insider trading scheme used Xbox audio chat to share info, netting thousands in profits.

entry.title: 'Like We Were Talking in Person': Zuckerberg’s Metaverse Is Coming to Life
entry.summary: Mark Zuckerberg and Lex Fridman did a podcast on AI entirely in the metaverse—and we’ve come a long way from Meta’s legless avatars.

entry.title: Blockchain Is 'Only Way' Forward for Gaming, Says Shrapnel Studio Head
entry.summary: Shrapnel Studio Head Don Norbury tells Kate Irwin the reasons why the upcoming first-person shooter game will offer a wide range of NFTs. He also reveals team-based gameplay plans and shares how game maps have already changed this year.

entry.title: Fortress CEO Responds to Ripple Backing Out of Acquisition
entry.summary: Fortress CEO Scott Purcell said Ripple wants to stick with its current B2B focus.

entry.title: Epic Games Is Jacking Up the Price of Fortnite V-Bucks
entry.summary: Alongside layoffs, Epic Games is also raising the price of Fortnite’s in-game currency, citing inflation and currency shifts.

entry.title: These Paris Fashion Week Outfits Transform Under Ultraviolet Light
entry.summary: Anrealage delivered a head-turning runway at Paris Fashion Week, spotlighting designer Kunihiko Morinaga's latest color-changing outfits.

entry.title: Social Media Sentiment Is Key to Crypto Price Discovery
entry.summary: Sacha Ghebali, Director of Strategy and Business Development at The TIE, says social media sentiment remains a key factor in price movements for major cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. However, he notes that sentiment has turned more negative lately amid regulatory uncertainty. Ghebali believes events like the Ripple lawsuit ruling significantly impacted sentiment and prices. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet.

entry.title: 500Altcoins discusses DeFi Summer and the Dubai Crypto Scene - This Time Will Be Different - Episode 2
entry.summary: Our host Reza Jafery is joined by Gareth Fenney aka 500Altcoins. They discuss the glory days of DeFi Summer and whether or not its a smart move for builders in the crypto space to relocate to Dubai.

entry.title: Decentralize Derivatives Trading with Custom Blockchain
entry.summary: David Gogel of dYdX discusses how the decentralized exchange is building a custom blockchain to fully decentralize derivatives trading. He explained how the new dYdX chain will allow validators to run order books in memory, enabling decentralized order matching at scale. This shift aims to increase security and transparency for traders while maintaining the performance of centralized exchanges.

entry.title: India's 1% Crypto Tax Has Been a Nightmare for High-Frequency Traders, Says Shardeum CEO
entry.summary: As India figures out its regulatory approach to the crypto industry, one thing is clear to Shardeum co-founder Nischal Shetty: “If you're a high-frequency trader, you can't afford to lose a percentage every time you sell,” he told Decrypt's Andre Beganski at Messari Mainnet in New York. “That's something that's caused a lot of issues.”

entry.title: Newly Partnered with Visa, Solana Focuses on Reliability
entry.summary: Solana has improved network reliability through upgrades like Quick and local fee markets. It recently partnered with Visa to allow settling transactions in USDC on Solana. This could enable merchants to receive instant payments and save on credit card processing fees. Stacy Elliott spoke with Austin Federa, Head of Strategy for the Solana Foundation, at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Crypto Accounting Challenges and Opportunities
entry.summary: As crypto matures, accounting and tax regulations are evolving. Amy Kalnoki of Bitwave explains how her company helps crypto companies properly account for digital assets. She notes the importance of flexibility as new crypto assets emerge and regulations change. Stacy Elliott interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Most Crypto Users Don't Trust Themselves to Keep Their Seed Phrase Safe: Ledger CEO
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Ledger CEO Pascal Gauthier to discuss crypto custody post-FTX, and the hardware wallet manufacturer's controversial Ledger Recover service.

entry.title: Base as a 'Bridge, Not an Island'
entry.summary: Coinbase's Jesse Pollak, creator of layer-2 blockchain Base, says the launch of the network has exceeded expectations, even if plans changed along the way. He believes Arbitrum One will help bring billions onto blockchain by enabling seamless user experiences. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Explosive Growth Ahead for Enterprise Blockchain
entry.summary: Paul Brody drives Ernst & Young (EY) initiatives and investments in blockchain technology across consulting, audit, and tax business lines. He says enterprise blockchain adoption is nearing an inflection point. Brody believes blockchains will one day handle 40 billion transactions daily across industries like automotive and pharma. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Building a Developer-Friendly zkRollup to Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Daniel Helm, head of Developer Relations at Scroll, discussess how they are building a zkRollup to scale Ethereum transactions and lower fees. He explained their focus on creating a seamless developer experience by maintaining Ethereum's ethos and tooling. Scroll aims to launch their mainnet soon, providing more scalable blockspace for Ethereum developers. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Regulation Threatens U.S. Dominance of Financial Markets, Says CoinRoutes CEO
entry.summary: Dave Weisberger, Co-Founder and CEO of CoinRoutes, argued that excessive regulation in the U.S. threatens to undermine the country's long-standing dominance in global financial markets. He warned that other countries are embracing blockchain and crypto to build more efficient digital markets, which could cause the US to lose its competitive edge and trillions in GDP. Weisberger said CoinRoutes is now focusing more on expanding internationally due to restrictive policies in the U.S. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Narrative Is Shifting Towards Layer-2 Solutions
entry.summary: Rich Rines, original Core DAO contributor and former Coinbase engineer, discusses how the narrative around Bitcoin is shifting in 2023. While Bitcoin remains digital gold, new layer 2 solutions are emerging to unlock more utility and value from the huge amounts of capital stored in Bitcoin. He says these innovations can benefit Bitcoin holders while keeping Bitcoin maximalists happy by building outside the base layer. André Beganski interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: We Need to Start Thinking About How we Make Crypto Easy to Use: Robinhood Crypto General Manager
entry.summary: Decrypt's Stacy Elliott sat down with Robinhood Crypto general manager Johann Kerbrat at Messari Mainnet 2023, to talk about the trading platform's crypto wallet, onboarding new users through simplicity, and keeping platform fees sustainable.

entry.title: On-Chain Gaming Poised for Mass Adoption
entry.summary: Jack O'Holleran is CEO and co-founder of SKALE Labs. He explains how on-chain gaming is ready for the mainstream after overcoming early challenges like high fees and poor user experience. Companies can now build blockchain games that look and feel like traditional games, and scalability improvements allow games to support hundreds of millions of players without performance issues. He was interviewed by André Beganski at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: New Blockchains Boom Creates Opportunity and Challenges
entry.summary: Billy Sebell of the XDC Foundation discussed the proliferation of new layer-1 and layer-2 blockchain solutions. While this expands possibilities, he noted projects must still attract users amidst growing competition. Sebell highlighted the benefits of targeting niche use cases and bringing real-world assets on-chain via tokenization. He was interviewed by André Beganski of Decrypt at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Accessible Self-Custody for Crypto
entry.summary: Dave Lemke is the CFO & CCO at Giddy, creators of a crypto wallet with decentralized private key security. He explains how their solution allows self-custody while still being recoverable. He highlighted increasing demand for self-custody after the FTX collapse. Lemke also touched on upcoming US crypto regulations and Getty's roadmap to simplify staking and other complex processes. Stacy Elliott interviewed him at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Defi Education Fund Advocates for Responsible Crypto Regulation
entry.summary: Amanda Tuminelli of the Defi Education Fund discusses the need for sensible crypto regulation. She says regulators should work with the industry to understand how protocols work before proposing expansive rules that could stifle innovation. Stacy Elliott of Decrypt interviewed her at Messari Mainnet 2023.

entry.title: Train Your Own AI-Powered Fighter? Inside AI Arena
entry.summary: What is AI Arena? Decrypt's Kate Irwin dives into the upcoming video game in an interview with the game's founders, AI Arena CEO Brandon Da Silva and COO Wei Xie.
